title: Bob Landers
text:
Robert John "Bob" Landers (1940-1996) was an Australian professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer in the <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Rugby%20League">New South Wales Rugby League</a> competition for the <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Eastern Suburbs</a> and <a href="Penrith%20Panthers">Penrith</a> clubs. A long-striding , Landers played with the <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Eastern Suburbs</a> club from (1959-1965) and played in the <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Roosters</a> 1960 grand final loss to <a href="St.%20George%20Dragons">St. George</a>. He was a student of St Josephs’ College in Sydney.
Playing career.
In 1959, Landers first season at the Eastern Suburbs club, he was selected to represent <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20rugby%20league%20team">New South Wales rugby league team</a>. Landers was the NSWRFL top point scorer in the <a href="1960%20NSWRFL%20season">1960 NSWRFL season</a>, and the <a href="1961%20NSWRFL%20season">1961 NSWRFL season</a>. After leaving <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Easts</a> at the end of the 1965 season Landers joined English club <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a> before returning to Australia where he played with <a href="Penrith%20Panthers">Penrith Panthers</a> in their first season in the NSWRFL in 1967.
He retired as Penrith's leading point scorer after 4 seasons in 1970. Landers was named as a winger in Penrith's 'Greatest Team' since its inception in 1967. While playing football, Landers also served in the <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Police%20Force">New South Wales Police Force</a>, and in 2008, rugby league's centennial year in Australia, he was named on the wing in a NSW Police team of the century.
